description: This file is a Python module responsible for seeding a demo database with synthetic financial transaction data. It includes functions to ensure a default user exists, generate recurring expenses, random expenses, and incomes across a specified time span, and clear existing demo data. The core purpose is to populate the database with realistic-looking sample data for demonstration or testing purposes, leveraging SQLAlchemy ORM for database interactions.

methods.name: User ensure_default_user(db: Session)
methods.description: Ensures that a demo user with id=1 exists in the database, creating it if necessary. Handles database schema variations such as missing columns and uses raw SQL fallback for robustness.

methods.name: date _month_start(d: date)
methods.description: Returns the first day of the given date's month.

methods.name: Iterable[date] _daterange(days_back: int)
methods.description: Generates a sequence of dates from days_back days ago up to today.

methods.name: str _random_desc(category: str)
methods.description: Provides a randomized description for a category, sampled from predefined options.

methods.name: list[dict] _generate_recurring_expenses(base_day: int = 1)
methods.description: Defines patterns for recurring monthly expenses.

methods.name: list[dict] _apply_recurring_for_month(month_start: date)
methods.description: Creates expense entries for a given month based on recurring patterns.

methods.name: dict _random_expense_for_date(dt: date)
methods.description: Generates a random expense transaction for a specific date, based on category averages.

methods.name: list[dict] _random_income_for_month(month_start: date)
methods.description: Generates 1-2 income entries per month, including salary and occasional additional income.

methods.name: int _count_transactions(db: Session, user_id: int)
methods.description: Counts total transactions for a user in the database.

methods.name: int clear_demo_data(db: Session)
methods.description: Deletes all transactions for the default demo user, making re-seeding safe and idempotent.

methods.name: dict load_demo_data( db: Session, months_back: int = 6, approx_total: int = 500, random_seed: int | None = 42, )
methods.description: Populates the database with synthetic transaction data over the last specified number of months, including recurring, daily expenses, and incomes. Provides a summary of the seeding process.

ctags.name: load_demo_data
ctags.signature: ( db: Session, months_back: int = 6, approx_total: int = 500, random_seed: int | None = 42, )
